200.description: Service is ready to handle requests

500.description: Service is not ready to handle requests

200.description: Cassandra is able to achieve the specified consistency

500.description: Cassandra is unable to achieve the specified consistency

200.description: List of new seeds after reload

req.name: value
req.description: The MB/s throughput cap for compaction in the system, or 0 to disable throttling

req.name: address
req.description: The address of the node to assassinate.

400.description: Cassandra node assasination request missing address

req.name: target
req.description: The component or class to set the log level for.

keyspaces.description: A list of keyspaces to snapshot

skipFlush.description: Whether to skip flushing the data

keyspaceTables.description: A list of keyspace and table names to snapshot, in the format 'keyspace.table'

When specifying keyspace_tables, specify.value: When specifying keyspace_tables, specifying keyspaces is not allowed

req.name: snapshotNames
req.description: A list of snapshot names to clear

req.name: keyspaces
req.description: A list of keyspaces to clear snapshots from

req.name: full
req.description: Whether to do a full repair

req.name: newToken
req.description: The new token to move the node to.

202.description: Job ID for successfully scheduled Cassandra node move request

req.name: is_superuser
req.description: Whether the user is a superuser

req.name: can_login
req.description: Whether the user can log in

req.name: profile
req.description: The profile to use for starting Cassandra/DSE.

req.name: replace_ip
req.description: The IP address to replace in the Cassandra/DSE configuration.

202.description: Cassandra already running and can connect

204.description: Cassandra already running but can't connect

206.description: Cassandra process not found but can connect
